intro: Veratrum nigrum var. parviflorum, commonly known as the small-flowered white hellebore, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the northeastern United States. It belongs to the Melanthiaceae family and is characterized by its tall, stout stem and large, showy white or pale green flowers. The plant produces dark, glossy berries that are toxic to humans and animals. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional herbal medicine.
